meanings.definition: The tendency of a nucleophile to donate an electron pair.
meanings.sent1: Her nucleophilicity was evident in her willingness to share her toys with others.
meanings.sent2: The chemist studied the nucleophilicity of different compounds in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The party's nucleophilicity was so high that everyone ended up sharing their snacks.
meanings.sent4: His generosity had a nucleophilicity that attracted people to him like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained nucleophilicity using a fun game where students shared crayons.

meanings.definition: The reactivity of a nucleophile in a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: The nucleophilicity of the compound determined its role in the reaction.
meanings.sent2: Scientists observed the nucleophilicity of the reagent under different conditions.
meanings.sent3: The party's nucleophilicity was so high that even the balloons seemed to react with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project had a nucleophilicity that sparked creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks displayed a nucleophilicity that lit up the night sky with vibrant colors.
